titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A day of wind with cooler temperatures, distinctly autumnal in feeling.
I laboured at a sermon for the Dedication Festival at Norwich Cathedral

: attended Evensong: motored to Blaydon on the Tyne, & joined Lord Durham at another recruit–hunting meeting. Culley went with me. On my return I held an extraordinary Chapter to deal with the cases of Steinthal & Morgan, & to appoint Bp. Quirk 'Acting Treasurer'.
